relation: HPU is not in position to offer huge grant for students. However what you get for your money is pretty special. All in, your cost might be just over $40k a year, but you definetely get your money's worth. And if you end up employed in your field of concentration after graduation (as do over 80%), it will have paid off.

High Point is a small town and not much surrounds the school, so HPU has created their own stress-free zone on campus. They have a game (arcade) room with pretty much everything from pool tables to ping pong, foosball, hoops, fruit ninja, pacman, and even karaoke. They also have their own theatre that shows movies before they are released to video or netflix. All comes at no extra charge for their students.

We did not eat on campus, but what we saw was impressive. One of the perks of attending HPU is being able to dine at the 1924 Prime Steakhouse. Each student is allowed to eat there (with reservation) once a week. They use the experience to teach students about international cuisine and proper dining etiquette. Additionally, there are other places on campus, around town, and into Greensboro that accept your HPU Passport card, so the meal plan is more than sufficient!

The dorms they display are to die for. Freshman Honors students are afforded the opportunity to live in fully furnished dorm suites that come with living rooms appointed with leather seating and flat panel TVs, full kitchens, dinette tables and two bedrooms.

This is the one area I'm not so sure of. The school does a tremendous job rolling out the red carpet that I wonder if it is overcompensating for a deficiency in this area. After all, its all about what you learn. I did not get the impression that the educational experience was lacking...I'm just unsure. Everything I saw was so outstanding, I almost felt like it was too good to be true. For that reason, I will remain neutral until I learn more. Without question, I will do the research.

By far, the best visit I had this spring break was provided by HPU. The college was so well appointed that it looked and felt like a vacation resort where learning occurs. I imagine their students prefer to stay on campus during holidays instead of going home.
